intro: Borreria minensis, commonly known as the Mexican broom, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands and scrublands. Borreria minensis is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
